claim_text: Critical minerals in the national strategy are framed by modern technology relevance and supply disruption risk
source_title: Australia's Critical Minerals Strategy 2023-2030
notes: Defines portfolio inclusion logic for strategic materials

claim_text: The strategy sets a pathway to move beyond extraction into processing and value-add with trusted partners
source_title: Australia's Critical Minerals Strategy 2023-2030
notes: Supports downstream ranking bias

claim_text: Australia lists 31 critical resource commodities as at 20 February 2024
source_title: Critical minerals
notes: Used as current commodity scope anchor

claim_text: Australian Critical Minerals Map 2024 records project status categories including operating and developing as at December 2024
source_title: Australian Critical Minerals Map 2024
notes: Supports hub and status mapping method

claim_text: The map dataset publication date is April 2024 with revision tracking in GA eCat
source_title: Australian Critical Minerals Map 2024
notes: Confirms recency window for geospatial baseline

claim_text: GA publications and portals include mine waste and re-mining resources relevant to secondary feedstock pathways
source_title: Publications and portals
notes: Supports circular and byproduct pathway inclusion

claim_text: EFTF mineral potential mapping covers copper zinc and rare earth element systems and completed national mapping in 2024
source_title: Mineral Potential Mapping | EFTF
notes: Publication date inferred from page completion statement

claim_text: CMMI is a collaboration between Geoscience Australia Geological Survey of Canada and USGS
source_title: Critical Minerals Mapping Initiative database updated to over 25000 samples
notes: Supports allied data-sharing relevance

claim_text: CMMI database update expanded to more than 25000 samples and improved representation of underrepresented and byproduct mineral systems
source_title: Critical Minerals Mapping Initiative database updated to over 25000 samples
notes: Key evidence for byproduct-led strategy in minor metals

claim_text: USGS Mineral Commodity Summaries 2026 provides current global production and trade baseline used for strategic leverage context
source_title: Mineral Commodity Summaries
notes: Used for external market concentration context

claim_text: The Australian Critical Minerals Portal is the interactive map entry point for critical minerals datasets
source_title: Australian Critical Minerals Portal
notes: Localized portal snapshot confirms portal type and GA data-access description; head metadata lines 7-9 indicate portal and data/persona framework.

claim_text: The CMMI persona is available through the GA portal for dedicated critical minerals mapping layers
source_title: Critical Minerals Mapping Initiative persona
notes: Localized persona URL snapshot plus source locator path confirms dedicated /persona/cmmi endpoint; page metadata confirms portal persona framework.

claim_text: Domestic copper research corpus in this workspace supports byproduct recovery pathways including selenium and tellurium in anode slime flowsheets
source_title: Dong et al. 2020 Comprehensive Recoveries from Copper Anode Slime
notes: Dong et al. 2020 localized PDF documents copper anode slime as by-product stream and explicit selenium/copper recovery flows (PDF p.1-2, p.7, p.14).

claim_text: Copper refining byproducts can include selenium and tellurium streams relevant to strategic minor metal recovery
source_title: Dong et al. 2020 Comprehensive Recoveries from Copper Anode Slime
notes: Dong et al. 2020 localized PDF explicitly covers selenium and tellurium-relevant byproduct recovery context from copper anode slime pathways (PDF p.1-2, p.14 references list and process discussion).

claim_text: Mining services capability and modular project delivery are already established Australian adjacencies that can be exported
source_title: Resources and Energy Quarterly December 2025
notes: REQ Dec 2025 provides quantitative export-scale anchors for iron ore (A$116.4b to A$107.4b forecast path; volumes toward 1,007 Mt) supporting adjacency scale argument (PDF p.8, p.21-22).

claim_text: Industrial power availability remains a first-order determinant of processing pathway competitiveness
source_title: Iron and Steel Technology Roadmap
notes: Replaced proxy source with IEA sector-primary roadmap: steel uses ~8% final energy, ~7% energy-sector CO2, and transition scenario adds ~720 TWh electricity demand by 2050, evidencing power-system competitiveness dependence (HTML lines ~1743, ~3299).

claim_text: The portfolio should distinguish export theses from domestic enablers to maintain strategic focus
source_title: Landscape framing inputs provided by project sponsor
notes: Core decision rule provided directly by user

claim_text: Industrial water is treated as a gating constraint and not a standalone export thesis in this portfolio design
source_title: Landscape framing inputs provided by project sponsor
notes: Explicitly requested de-emphasis decision

claim_text: The review estimates metals production contributes about 40% of industrial GHG emissions, 10% of global energy use, and 3.2 billion tonnes of minerals mined annually.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys
notes: Raabe 2023, p. 2436 (abstract and introduction figures).

claim_text: The review states demand currently exceeds available scrap by about two-thirds and at least one-third of metals will remain primary even under favorable circular conditions.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: Steel is cited at roughly 1.9-2.2 tCO2 per tonne in global-average production and around 8% of total global emissions.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: For copper, pyrometallurgical processing accounts for over 80% of primary supply and shortage risk can reach 10 Mt by 2030 if no new mines open.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: The review estimates global end-of-life copper recycling at 30-40%, with some regions above half of use-phase material.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: Secondary copper from scrap is reported at about 30-80% lower energy demand than primary routes, with global-average emissions around 0.2-1.9 tCO2 per tonne.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: The review reports lithium market volume around 400 thousand tonnes in 2021 with expected growth near 20% annually during the next decade.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys

claim_text: An indicative 1000 kg/120 kWh EV battery is cited with approximately 15 kg Li, 80 kg Ni, 25 kg Mn, 27 kg Co, and up to 250 kg graphite.
source_title: The Materials Science behind Sustainable Metals and Alloys
